questions.question: Why is it important to measure friction losses in a straight pipe?

answers.a: To determine the chemical properties of the fluid
answers.b: To design efficient piping systems with minimum energy loss
answers.c: To calculate the heat generated by the fluid

explanations.a: Chemical properties are unrelated to friction loss.
explanations.b: Correct! Measuring friction loss helps optimize energy use in pipe systems.
explanations.c: Heat generation is not the primary concern here.
explanations.d: Capillary action occurs in narrow tubes, not in general pipe flow.

questions.question: Which of the following parameters does not directly affect friction loss in a pipe?

explanations.a: Longer pipes create more frictional resistance.
explanations.b: Velocity is directly proportional to friction loss in turbulent flow.
explanations.c: Correct! Fluid color has no effect on friction loss.
explanations.d: Roughness affects the friction factor and loss.

questions.question: What is the unit of frictional head loss in fluid flow?

explanations.a: Pascal is a unit of pressure, not head loss.
explanations.b: Correct! Head loss is expressed in meters (of fluid column).
explanations.d: Newton is a unit of force.

questions.question: In turbulent flow, how does frictional loss typically vary with velocity?

explanations.a: This is true for laminar flow, not turbulent.
explanations.c: Correct! In turbulent flow, head loss is roughly proportional to the square of velocity.
explanations.d: Friction loss always depends on velocity.

questions.question: Which device is commonly used to measure pressure drop across a straight pipe?

explanations.b: Orifice meter is used for flow rate measurement.
explanations.c: Correct! U-tube manometer measures pressure difference accurately.
explanations.d: Flow nozzle measures flow rate, not pressure drop.
